utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: Grandma's got some cash, we can steal that.

utterance.speaker: GUY 2
utterance.content: What kind of creep are you? We steal from strangers.

utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: Yeah, grandma's not going to call the cops.

utterance.speaker: GUY 2
utterance.content: Look... Either you start doing this, or you get a job. That guy. You're going to remember that guy for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: Hey, how you doing? I said, hey, give me all your cash!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Why? Want to buy yourself a pretty dress, you little bitch?

utterance.speaker: GUY 2
utterance.content: He ain't kidding, man. Where's your wallet?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: On your sister's nightstand. Forgot it after I paid her.

utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: Woah, Tony!

utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: I think he's sick. Maybe you shouldn't...

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: He's faking. Go in his pockets, grab his wallet. Good, let's go.

utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: You all right, man?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: He's fine, he's faking it.

utterance.speaker: GUY 1
utterance.content: Yeah, I need an ambulance. At Maple and Fourth. It's a really sick

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Are you happy? Let's go!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Today, we are hunting for the cat burglar of diseases. Causes a healthy man's lungs to fail, leaves no fingerprints.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Respiratory distress could be asthma.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No hyperinflation on the X-ray.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Food allergy. Could have eaten shellfish or peanuts.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No hives. No erythema on the skin.
Pulmonary embolism.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Embolisms don't magically dissolve. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Laryngospasm. Frosty fall air hits his vocal chords, they spasm shut... Choke him out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good idea. You've been tremendously helpful, you can leave.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I just hired him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well I fired him. To infinity.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You didn't tell him I was coming back?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She did, I said no.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: When your extended job interview slash reality TV show killed a patient, you lost your veto power. Everybody, this is Dr. Foreman, he will...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Does this mean there's one less slot for us?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's still Dr. House's department. He decides who stays, who goes...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman goes!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: But Dr. Foreman will be my eyes and ears. You do nothing without his knowledge.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, uh, just in case I need them, where exactly will Dr. Foreman be keeping my balls? If you want to keep your jobs, that never happened. The only way to get the cat burglar is to catch him in the act. Give the patient a methacholine challenge, see if it sets off laryngospasm.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: You want us to stop his breathing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, only until you can figure out why. After that it'd be irresponsible. You and I should talk.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm sorry, she didn't have to do that publicly.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes she did! She had to establish her dominance in front of them, limit my power.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: There's nothing we can do.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that's not the never-say-never Dr. Foreman I know. There's lots we can do.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not really, Cuddy won't...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can make you miserable.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's true.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Until you quit, again. So why don't we just skip the middleman?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm not quitting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My god, not everything's about you, and your little job, and your little world. This is about restoring order in the universe.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm not quitting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're going to be miserable.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I already am miserable.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Cuddy obviously thinks we're idiots, she's not going to let House hire any one of us.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Tidal volume's holding at 1.2 litres. Increase the dose.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: So which master do we serve? Whose ass do we have to kiss to get this job?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: You really want this job so bad? How about you try doing this job? Double the dose

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: My foot's tingling. Is that normal?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: No. What exactly does it...

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: And my stomach's killing me. Could this test cause that stuff?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Test was a bust.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Amber has moved down to even money.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We found two new symptoms.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Oh. Back to 2-1.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You're the favourite.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: House's?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: To get fired.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You can bet against yourself. Lovely parting gift.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: What's the limit?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Isn't one.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: 500 on Kutner.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Oh, 1000 on Amber.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Do you take cheques?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How do we connect abdominal pain, and numbness in the extremities, with respiratory collapse?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Dissecting aortic aneurysm.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Doesn't cover all three. What else?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Carry on, he's the boss.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Uh, what about a spinal cord lesion?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Have to be in the brain stem and it still doesn't explain the lungs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Weird, though... That he's the boss. Didn't he quit recently? Was it a money issue?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Lungs, stomach, numbness?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No that wasn't it, it was something else... Was it bling account? Med plan didn't cover tattoo removal?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We have to unify these symptoms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh! I remember. You don't want to turn into me. Right? You didn't want to become evil.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Can we stick to the medicine here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Absolutely. I'm just flattered. In a few short weeks, seems like I've just turned towards the light. I mean... either that or you've sold your soul.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Multiple marantic emboli could...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get a raise? 'Cause then you're a whore. Or didn't you? 'Cause then you're a stupid whore. Patient just crashed. Can they go, boss?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're right.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No but. You're right about all of it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, then, I'll see you at the reunion.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It seems I didn't get out of here soon enough. The world thinks I've been corrupted, so no one will hire me. I hate being here. I'd love to quit... but I can't.
He's got a pulse.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Must be another respiratory collapse. Means this is our chance to prove laryngospasm.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We need to tube him and bag him.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We will, right after we figure out...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: If we just let him die, it doesn't matter what he has.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Brennan, tilt his head back so I can get a straight shot.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Okay, while you're killing him... I'll get the intubation kit.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I decided you're right. You're obviously in an impossible position. There's no point in me humiliating you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So I'm going to humiliate Cuddy, until she fires you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Guy's faking. It's Munchausen’s. You notice the EMT run sheet? Paramedic who brought him in is also named Martin Harris.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well. If the name was Attila Von Weinerschnitzel, I'd say you might be on to something.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Look. Room 406, abdominal pain. Room 403, left-sided numbness. 402, syncope. He's copying his neighbours' symptoms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, coincidence is much more likely than you being a stubborn jerk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Munchausen's patients create symptoms, not names.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Munchausen's patients have medical histories they don't want us reading.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No laryngeal spasm.
Breathing's resumed normal rate. Without intubation.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: See? Nothing's wrong with him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's in a lab coat. Munchausen's pretend to be patients, not doctors. He's got mirror syndrome.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Giovannini's?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you know another mirror syndrome? Brain's got no idea who he is, where he is or what he is. But it fills the holes with whatever dirt's lying around. He reads a name tag, he's got a name. Sees a doctor, he's got a job. Sees symptoms, he's got a problem.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: My explanation's simpler.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well if it's simple, then we discharge the nut bar. But if it's complicated, then the nut bar has got brain damage.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So we let him jerk them around for a few days until we're sure?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, we let him jerk you around. There's a faster way.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mind if we play through?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Sure, what could possibly go wrong?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What's going on here, Martin?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Operation?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House, who is this guy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Excellent question. Who are you, Martin? He just likes to watch, do stuff.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Number ten scalpel for initial incision. Glad you're here, House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Of course you are. It's lecture time.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah, it is. Stop worrying about the power play.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Was that it? I think you can go a lot deeper here. I mean, WHY am I so obsessed by all of this?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're threatened by Foreman and feel the need to impress Cuddy. The only thing that's relevant is Foreman is a good doctor. He can help you, lighten the load.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good idea. I'll have him sort my mail.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Sure! Deflect.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Who is this guy?!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think we just found out.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: It's all about Cuddy. Got to be the alpha dog. Can almost smell the pheromones now, huh?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I like him.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Hah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Told you I didn't need you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House, what is going on?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Owww!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your blood's turned to sludge. If we don't heat you up, you're going to die. Can't fake that!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mirror syndrome patients have no agenda, no axe to grind. They can read you because they have to. Moods, attitudes, everything. They're like mind readers. Except they can read your mind.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Unfortunately, we have to cure him. His hand wasn't black when he came in, the operating room was sterile, the only thing different was the temperature. Cold agglutinins means...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: It's got to be some kind of infection.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No fever, so it's got to be a tiny infection, hard to find.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You'd better find it fast. This guy feels another cool breeze, his blood turns to slop and he drops. I need three ways to pinpoint infection.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Blood cultures.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Blood's clumpy. Nothing you can do with it.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Unless we soak him in warm water before we draw it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good, what else?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Ultrasound his abdomen, look for an abscess.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good. Uh, ladies and gentlemen, I have a regrettable announcement. Kitchen has just learned that our annual shipment of mayonnaise was improperly stored, so anybody who ate... well, the food, should head across the lobby to the clinic right away. Ask for Dr. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're not punishing Cuddy, you're punishing every doctor in the building.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's her building, her doctors. Still need one more.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Well, we need to find out his history. Where he's been, what he's done.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Yeah he has no memory, but his bio's tattooed to his rear?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The mayo is fine. You can stay where you are. I'm a doctor.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mail order. I've seen the diplomas. Two N's in university. Big Love was right. History's the key.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: No ID, no wallet. No missing persons report filed for a hundred miles.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The key is the key. He had car keys in his pocket when he was admitted. Keep him in the isolation room, so he doesn't pick up extreme bitch syndrome from one of the nurses. Run the ultrasound and the blood cultures.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: The cultures were my idea.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No one's keeping score... You're losing. Search the street where he was mugged, find the car and the registration.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: There could be thousands of cars. Why do I get this assignment?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because if you deal with the patient, he's going to wind up singing Osmond songs and proposing to five nurses at once.
I'll go with Cole.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ooh. We have a love connection.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Make a fist... Little pinch.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Wow, that's a strong pinch.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: This thing works, you're lucky you've got me. My colleague wanted to cook you in boiling water.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: That's right, baby. My blood's that good.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: That's supposed to be me, right?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: No. That's me. I'm always right. Got to be.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I don't think I'm always...

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: If they don't like you, you got to be right, or you're not worth anything.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Infections can hide deep beneath the skin. This will find them.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Who was that last doctor?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Dr. Amber Volakis.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Don't really need her name.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Wait. You saying that... You... I want--her?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Don't know what you want. Don't care what you want.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I'm married.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: So am I.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Even if I wasn't, She's a little too, uh... aggressive for me.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Hey. Aggressive is never a bad thing.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Yeah, true. I'm done.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Yeah. We've got to run some more tests. You can clean yourself up.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Lesion on the liver. Cystic or solid?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Solid.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well, you certainly did the right thing by coming to me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, I needed a smug oncologist...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: An authoritative oncologist.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I hate you. Tell me why.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I've been scanning literature, very interesting study in Sweden. Apparently, Giovannini's patients mimic whoever they think's in charge.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Any country with that low an age of consent and that high a rate of suicide isn't thinking straight.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I am in charge of our relationship.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It was a surgery. You were the surgeon. In that setting...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You would pick up my laundry if I asked you to.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Go ahead, ask.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Oh, I wouldn't do that to you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I want all my personal private doctors back right now. Except for Foreman.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Your team, Foreman included, is dealing with the great mayonnaise panic of 2007. Frankly, I'm worried it might spread to other continents.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lesion on the liver. Possibility... Why are you doing a pelvic for food poisoning?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: She said her hoo hoo burned.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lesion on the liver, ideas?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Start with a biopsy to rule out cancer.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Could be an abscess.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Needle works for that too.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Unless it's a vascular hemangioma. Aspirate that, he'll bleed out, we'll kill him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If he bleeds out we'll know what he had.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Had?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Two diagnoses out of three he lives. We do nothing three out of three he dies. Go stick his liver.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Where's Foreman? We should...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You need him to draft your letter of resignation?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You risking our patient's life to get back at Cuddy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What? No, that would be childish. This is what I'm doing to get back at Cuddy. Who here doesn't have any health insurance? Michael Moore was right. MRI's, pet scans, neuro-psych tests, private rooms for all these patients. Fight the power!

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Sorry, I missed. I have to reposition the needle. You're going to feel another pinch. You still with me?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I'm here.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: You feeling faint?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: It's personal.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: You got personal problems? You've got no memory.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I'm in a hospital. I don't want to be in a hospital.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Well... you're sick, so...

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I'm bored. You ask what's wrong, then you ignore the answer, just go on with what you're doing. You think everything's okay as long as you don't think about it, don't deal with it. Is that blood?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I think it's pus from a fungus.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I have fungus in me?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: If you've been in the tropics in the last few months. I saw this in tsunami survivors. Their skin grafts would ooze black pus, sometimes weeks later. Traced the fungus back to the sand in the tsunami tides.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: That's so cool.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I think the black pus is fungal. If I'm right, that's where the cold agglutinins are coming from, that's what's driving his memory loss. Amber's putting him on amphotericin, it will cure him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This makes no sense.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I'm doing blood tests to be sure, but the sooner we get him on...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not talking about the infection. I'm talking about you letting Tonya Harding administer the treatment.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I'm out of the game.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: A couple of weeks ago you named me grumpy, said I didn't want to be here, I wanted to be back in the Third world.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you realised I'm right just now?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I got a confirmation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The patient's nuts.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: The patient's... unbiased. The patient has no axe to grind.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The patient is nuts.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I miss my old life helping people who barely have clean water, let alone the kind of medicines we waste by the SUV load.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're nuts. You're going to be miserable, at home, at work, somewhere. The goal in life is not to eliminate misery, it's to keep misery to the minimum.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Oh, that's inspiring.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You said you came back to get married. What does your fiancée do?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: She's a court reporter.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Uh-huh, well I'm sure Thailand will have courts any day now. Someone's going to be miserable sometime. Accept it. It's how I stay so happy.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Why do you care if I stay?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're good. Don't screw it up just because you're miserable.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I'm going to--stay until the patient's cured. Which should be in about... an hour.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Not okay.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Which one of us is he mirroring?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Well if it was you, he'd be inflicting pain on someone else, so... I'd say he's mimicking whichever

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Heating blanket wasn't keeping him warm enough. Ordered a whirlpool, got his blood flowing. So far, it's keeping his rash at bay.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Rash worse equals cold agglutinins worse. Means what was in his liver wasn't fungus.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Yeah, labs confirmed...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: That it wasn't even pus, it was just coagulated blood caused by the cold agglutinins.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which you mistook for a cool fungus that you saw after the tsunami.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Same consistency...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You saw what you wanted to see, not what was there. Wait a second. Didn't you quit?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I spoke to my fiancée, I'm staying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Of course you are. Because you're the exact right amount of miserable.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Broad spectrum antibiotics aren't working. It's got to be viral or exotic bacteria.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There are a thousand microbes it could be.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We could repeat all the cultures, maybe we just missed it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or... we can get an accurate history.
We're working on it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that'll be a good solace to the widow X.
His car was towed and the tow gate's locked. The guys must be out on a run.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's why I sent two of you. One of you breaks in, the other posts bail.
Getting arrested is not what I'm worried about.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not a problem. You know how to kill dogs, right?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So, back to repeating all the cultures.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or... we get an accurate history.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Didn't we just rule out that possibility?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You guys ever heard any of my metaphors yet? Come on. Sit on grandpa's lap as I tell you how infections are criminals, the immune system's the police... Seriously, grumpy, get up here. It'll make us both happy. Anyway, cops don't just let crooks run free. They keep fingerprints, mug shots. The immune system does the same thing, only it calls them antibodies. We find out what diseases he's had in his life, good chance that'll tell us where he's been in his life. Alice. Your turn through the looking glass. Draw blood and CSF.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wait, guys. I haven't signed off on this.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You seem like a good guy, Cuddy seems decent. House... doesn't. It means either you're going to give in, or Cuddy is. Either way... I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Your boyfriend has me at even odds.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: So... Talk to him.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I did. He said he's just responding to market forces.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He is. I got a hundred on you. What do you care what other people are betting on?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If he's trying to screw with me because he's jealous Cuddy didn't ask him to take this job...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Right. You're figuring he's jealous of your misery.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's messed up enough to...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: The problem is you're not miserable.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Then House has been wasting a lot of time.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You've been humiliated, treated like crap. You've every right to be miserable, but you're not, because even though this job is insane and House is insane, you like it. You always have.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You know what's worse than a sanctimonious speech? A sanctimonious speech that's dead wrong.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: See? You belong with House.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We're going to use your spinal fluid to tell us where you lived.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not really. It's a poor substitute for an actual history, and without...

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Nah, it's cool.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Yes, it is. I need you to stay as still as possible. Ignore the pain.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Bring the pain.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I'm not a masochist.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Neither am I.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I know, but I was responding to you responding to... Never mind. I just like experience. If it's new, it's interesting.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Yeah? Not me. I don't just like new. I've got to have new. If it's not there, I make it there.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Really, I'm just easily bored.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: There are 300 million people in this country. If I'm doing exactly what everyone else is doing, then who the hell am I? You know what I mean?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I'm just about finished.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I like hot tubs. They're nice.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You don't knock?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are you putting KY jelly on his phone receiver? An exploding snake in his drawer?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No. I'm replacing his Vicodin stash with laxatives.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Don't. Don't stoop to his level.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why? Because he's suddenly going to realise he's no longer 14? Either I take his garbage forever, or I give him a reason to stop.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You don't have to make him miserable. Just... make him think that he's won.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm not going to fire Foreman.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I said THINK he's won. Find some other way to soothe his ego. The thing's big enough. You must be able to find some corner to polish.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Where were you two hours ago?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Where were you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What do you have?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: High titers to histoplasmosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Probably lived in the Ohio river valley.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Also weakly positive on coccidiomycosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Weak means older. Means he moved to Ohio from the San Joaquin valley.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Or he happened to visit California.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: He's also positive for Chagas disease.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Central America.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Or he kissed his maid from El Salvador. Or he sat next to someone from Belize on a flight to Weehawken or he ate lettuce from Honduras...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes! You're right, buzz kill. This tells us next to nothing. But since that's on the something side of nothing, thought we'd go with it.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: His rash is back. Hot tub isn't hot enough to keep his body warm.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So we take his body out of the picture. Let's hit it from the inside. Lipopolysaccharide.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: LPS won't just give him a fever. He could hit 110, fry his brain.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or make him just toasty enough to keep his blood flowing free. Like my bowels. You smell that? Not going to get sweeter.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You nailed Brennan for seeing what he wanted to see. You're no different.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But you are. You used to like this stuff. You left here because you didn't like what you were turning into. You like who you are now? You like being Cuddy's errand boy? That was just a courtesy flush. I'm not actually done.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You want to induce a fever?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Unless you're willing to don a white T-shirt and hop into the hot tub with him, I need another way to keep him warm, or he dies.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You could maim him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I could cure him.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm not letting you do it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Are you going to fire me?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wait a second. What the hell was that? You were won over by my soaring rhetoric? I basically just threatened to hold my breath... You never intended to stop me. You just pretended to stop me, so you could pretend to fail to stop me, so you could stroke my ego. Uh-Uh. War doesn't end till Foreman's gone.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Foreman's not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And... I know when my Vicodin isn't Vicodin. Do you know when your birth control pills aren't birth control pills?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: If we can keep your fever up, we can get you back on dry land. You feeling okay?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Surprisingly, yeah, I feel pretty good.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's not the way fevers usually work.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Nothing around here works the way it's supposed to work.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No kidding.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: You're giving me a fever. Doctors don't give people fevers.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It was necessary to keep your blood flowing.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Yeah. It was necessary. And that was all that mattered. It's exciting, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're happy?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Why wouldn't I be?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Oh hey. Hey, you with me? I need help in here! V-fib. We've got to shock him.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Get him out of the water.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: How long's he been out?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Just a few seconds.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He's dry enough.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Not yet!

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Dry faster.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Ten more seconds.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He'll get brain damage, you need...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Kutner, you'll arc it...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He's dry enough. Clear.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It worked.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: For one of them.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Cardiac arrest. We were able to shock him back to a normal sinus rhythm and Kutner nearly into a coma.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So now you've electrocuted yourself and set a patient on fire. I like the dedication.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It wasn't a compliment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, it was. The insult comes now. You're insane! You either have an aversion to towels, or you want pain. I think both. I'm thinking it goes back to high school gym...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Anybody think we should discuss which infection is causing the cold agglutinins before they stop his heart again?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sure, why not?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Until they find his car, we have to assume he's travelled to Ohio, California, Central America, and possibly Weehawken.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Nothing on the blood cultures.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do them again. Quadruple run time.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We know the infection is in his heart. We do a biopsy, we see polys, we got bacterial. Lymphs, we got viral.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: He just had a heart attack. Ripping out a piece might kill him.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah... We biopsy his toe instead!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No! That's a terrible idea. Won't tell us anything. Biopsy his heart. Come on, I'll join you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got you a job. Mount Zion hospital in Boston.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: They have a great diagnostics department.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Gilchrist said he'd take you anyway.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That was... Very nice of you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, god. Does everything have to be about you? It's simple math. I'm not going to back down. You're not going to back down. Cuddy's not going to back down. No one's going to be happy here. And Cuddy's going to end up pregnant.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't matter.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Are you saying? What does you having sex with...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Starts Monday. I could help you pack.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I don't want the job.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What? Why not? You're miserable.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Apparently not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, you're gonna be. Are you smiling?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do your own stupid biopsy.
His name's Robert Elliot. He's from Hamilton, Ohio.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Here's everything he had in his trunk and in his glove box.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No need for the heart biopsy. I now know exactly who he is and what he has. You saved his life.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, you idiot. It's vapour rub and lunch receipts.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: We have his name. We can find his doctor, get his medical records.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's 8:00 at night. The biopsy will be faster. Not fast enough to save him, but that's hardly the point. Thirteen. Is your name Thirteen? Why did you volunteer to go street walking?
I thought I could help that way.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A black Mormon could help that way. There's no reason for you to want to be there. Which means there's a reason you didn't want to be here. Didn't want to look in the mirror?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi. Cuddy called. She needs you to iron her shirts. We'll take over. Go ahead. Talk to him.
Uh... you might feel a little tug when the catheter's in the heart.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Come on. Make him feel comfortable.
I've done this procedure dozens of times. It's completely...

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: My god. You are incredibly hot.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not here, deal with her.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Are you an idiot? Do you not think she's hot?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not the alpha here. She is. She's my boss.
The rash is back.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Increase the drip. If... you think that's the right thing to do.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: This is so frustrating.
I don't think that's me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey. Get in there, see how he's doing.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You were just in there.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, apparently, it's impossible to see anything else while I'm in there. I'm a blinding white hot light of power.
Got it. Pink. Good size. Nice specimen.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I'm scared.
It's okay, it's going to be okay.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: No. No, it's not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I'm not interested in how he's doing. I'm interested in how she's doing. So get in there and tell me how he's doing.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You think he'll mimic her if I'm in there with her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're a powerful, dominating man, but who knows?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: So I'm going to get fired before her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, you're going to get fired right now unless you get in there...
Nothing on the biopsy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And how is he?
His fever's at 106...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know. But how is he? Bitter? Sexually frustrated?
He's delightful. Loves the smell of freshly baked rhubarb pie and isn't afraid to love. Also, his rash is coming back.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He needs the meds and the tub. Just to keep him stable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine. Soak him again.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He'll be happy. Loves hot tubs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, you love hot tubs. Find the rest of the gang, tell them to meet me at the lecture hall.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Hate hot tubs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What did you say?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I hate...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He likes. Who else was in there?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: No-one.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You didn't think to mention that?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: The guy likes warm, swirling water. I didn't know that was diagnostic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not. What it is, is the water hit him and he had a thought. Not about you, but about him. We need to splash him some more.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Do I know you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You look familiar.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My name's Robert Elliot. I'm from Hamilton, Ohio.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Me too. What do you do?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Stuff.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What brings you to New Jersey? Is it work or vacation?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Uh... Work.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What type of work?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I'm tired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I eat out a lot. In a lot of restaurants. Knotty Pine. Ritchies.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I know those places.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They're good, huh?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: They're convenient.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: They're on the road.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You on the road a lot?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: No more than you I suppose.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You ever use this stuff? I use it all the time.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I use it all the time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah. I just said that. You know, the cool thing about this stuff is... You can do a lot with it. Soften your skin, treat scrapes. Naughty stuff. Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Because... It doesn't smell like dung.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're saying you like the smell?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Not really. Just doesn't smell like dung.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Something else does smell like dung?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Yeah. Dung.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You guys ready? Now is the time you stare at me, in slack-jawed amazement. He sells farm equipment. See? Pig lagoons, pig farms. And, as every child knows, where you have pigs, you have pig poo. But as very few children know, where you have pig poo, you have eperythrozoon infection.
We'll start him on clarithromycin.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This time tomorrow, he'll be back to his old self. Whoever that might be.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It can wait.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He has a temperature of 107.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It can wait 15 minutes. You know where Cuddy is?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Hi, I'm the Dean of Medicine.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi, I'm the guy who saved your life.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So what if it's House?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Then I take the job at Mount Zion.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: There is no job at Mount Zion.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House said that...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well if House said it, it must be true.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I can fire him. I can fire him now. I can fire him tomorrow. I don't even need a reason.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She doesn't fire me, she never will fire me, she needs me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He's a good doctor. That's all. I respect his expertise, and I...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's hot for me. Always...

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, that could have been either of us.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: You have great yabos.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: That still could have been either of us.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You lose.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Seriously... I have always thought my breasts were one of my best features.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You all suck. The two of you, took 14 hours to find a car. You, forgot to mention that the guy with no memory, had memories. You keep on thinking, that insane guys have hidden wisdom. You're going to wind up shooting people on the subway. Something.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: So, which one of us sucks the most?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's a tie.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Between?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: All of you.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We're all fired?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: None of you are fired.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That was nice of you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why didn't you fire anyone?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They're good doctors.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Right, why didn't you let Brennan quit?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's a good doctor.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Right... By not letting anyone go, you made six people happy and one person happy and rich. Chase won every one of those bets, so either you're just really nice or what's your cut?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 50%... How bad you want to keep your job?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'll keep my mouth shut

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey.. You actually do want to stay, don't you?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I think I do.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Every one of those idiots got some insight about themselves from the pig salesman. Not one of them did anything about it. People don't learn, they don't change, but you did. You're a freak!
